wysiwyg_a.p: This function block implements an event-driven up-counter with a reset input which changes the state of output 'Q' when a predefined value has been reached.

wysiwyg.p: Each 'CU'-Event counts up 'CV' by one and fires a 'CUO'-Event. If the 'PV'-input value is equal or greater than the 'CV' value output value 'Q' shows TRUE. For a restart, the counter needs a reset via the 'R'-Event input.
- Increments the value of the 'CV'-output by one
The 'CV'-output value contains the number of triggered 'CU'-Events since startup resp. since the last 'R'-Event. The maximum value at 'PV' must be smaller than 65535.
